column3: I don't believe we want to deal with the potential of CSRF issues in the JSON API, not to mention that exposing the RPC port to the internet is currently a reliable way to get yourself robbed. (And I assume it would be almost as bad with the users browser acting as a proxy)\n
The RPC port doesn't need to be exposed to the internet. There are a number of ways to circumvent the same origin policy this just makes it easier for those with legitimate uses.\n
Yeah, I think these sort of things are more appropriate via a proxy\n
FYI this has been discussed at https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/23 and https://bitcointalk.org/index.php?topic=2672.0 before.\n
Apologies, feel free to close the request.\n
